intro: Bartsia multifida, commonly known as the forked bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often deeply lobed. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Bartsia multifida is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows.
